cluster_description: Very high herbaceous cover (>90%), very low shrub and tree cover, high NDVI and minimal built surface. Represents intensively managed, continuous short-vegetation surfaces.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are dominated by a continuous sward of short, regularly mown herbaceous turf forming an uninterrupted herbaceous cover across the plot. Tree and shrub cover is minimal, typically limited to scattered trees at plot margins, and paved or informal paths are generally absent within the surveyed plots. Maintenance intensity is high and formal, with clear evidence of recent or regular mowing; plots show long sightlines (>30 m) and an absence of visible litter, vehicles, people, or street furniture in most cases. These characteristics indicate managed, open grassy plots with consistent short-vegetation structure and low woody-vegetation density.

cluster_description: Dominated by large (>5 m) tree canopy (≈70% cover) with little ground-layer herb cover and very high NDVI; minimal built cover. Represents closed, mature tree canopy stands.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots assigned to the mature closed-canopy woodland category are characterized by continuous, dense tree foliage forming a closed canopy with a well-developed understorey. Vegetation within plots appears unmanaged or semi-wild, with limited visibility into the interior (visibility typically on the order of 10–30 m) and minimal evidence of formal access or built infrastructure. Ground conditions within plots frequently include dense undergrowth and leaf litter; no people, vehicles, or man-made structures are evident in the majority of plots.

cluster_description: High herbaceous cover with some scattered trees and low-to-moderate woody layers; high NDVI and low built cover. Represents grass-dominated open areas with occasional trees.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by an open grassy sward of short, regularly mown turf punctuated by scattered mature trees that form an open canopy. The understorey is predominantly herbaceous with limited woody or shrub development, producing a parkland-like structure of grass punctuated by isolated trees.

cluster_description: Moderate herb cover with substantial large-tree canopy (~35%) and moderate small-tree/shrub layers; high NDVI and modest built cover. Represents parkland or green spaces with significant canopy trees.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by a continuous short-mown grass sward with scattered, mature trees establishing a tree-dominated, open understorey. The tree layer is spatially widespread across plots, producing an overstorey that intersperses open herbaceous turf; sightlines in these plots extend beyond 30 m. Vegetation condition indicates recent mowing and moderate maintenance intensity, and visual clutter is minimal.

cluster_description: Multi-layered woody structure: substantial large-tree and small-tree cover with moderate shrub and herb layers; high NDVI and very low built cover. Represents mixed or maturing woodland with understory.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots were characterized by a tree-dominated canopy with scattered mature trunks and an open understorey. The ground layer was composed of leaf litter with interspersed grasses, and vegetation density allowed medium visibility (~10–30 m). Vegetation appeared largely unmanaged (low to semi-wild maintenance), with no visible adjacent built infrastructure or human presence.

cluster_description: Intermediate NDVI with high proportion of built surface (~46%) and residual herb/shrub cover. Represents built-dominated urban areas with patchy vegetation (gardens, yards, paved residential areas).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by an extensive built matrix (paved surfaces, roads and parking/garage courts) with interspersed, patchy vegetation. Vegetation elements occur as small grassy patches with evidence of recent mowing or regularly mown lawns, shrub-dominated margins, and occasional tree-dominated areas with an open understorey. Vegetation is typically peripheral to or in small islands within paved areas rather than forming contiguous cover. Maintenance intensity across plots ranges from low/sem-iwild to moderate. Visibility distances within plots are generally medium (approximately 10–30 m), and residential buildings form the dominant structural backdrop.

cluster_description: Substantial herbaceous cover with moderate small and large trees and shrubs; high NDVI and very low built cover. Represents semi-natural grasslands or meadows with scattered woody elements (urban meadow/wooded grassland).
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots were open, natural meadows dominated by tall herbaceous vegetation (tall-herb meadow) with scattered trees. Maintenance intensity was very low (untended) with no evidence of recent mowing. Plots exhibited moderate visibility distance (~10–30 m), minimal visual clutter, and no visible paths, built structures, roads, water bodies, street furniture, people, or litter.

cluster_description: Very low NDVI and negligible vegetation cover, overwhelmingly built/impervious (>85%). Represents sealed surfaces such as rooftops, paved yards, parking lots and other impervious hard-standing.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterised by an extensive, continuous paved/impervious ground surface forming the dominant ground cover. Hard-standing areas include marked bays and large paved expanses with little to no vegetation within the central plot; vegetative elements, when present, are limited to narrow peripheral strips or individual trees and hedgerows at plot margins. Plots typically abut built infrastructure (e.g. buildings, fences) and present clear, long sightlines across the paved surface.

cluster_description: Moderate NDVI with substantial herb cover (~53%), moderate built cover (~27%), and modest tree presence. Represents residential gardens, green yards or small urban green patches within built fabric.
habitat_description_from_photos: Plots are characterized by a well-maintained, short-mown grass sward punctuated by a single large, mature tree located near the plot center. Residential buildings frame the plot perimeter. No paved footpaths, street furniture, parked vehicles, litter, or people are visible within the plots.
